intro: Centaurea todaroi subsp. seguenzae, commonly known as the Seguenza's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
